title: Data Preparation
text:
The data were collected by a third party and given to the researchers as an SPSS data file. We selected the necessary variables from the full data set and exported them in .csv format for analysis in R.
Table 1 shows the collected variables with original questions and short-hand names.


Table 1: Variables exported from SPSS







Exported name
Survey question
Short-hand name

Fire

Nuclear

Work

Leisure-time accident (at home/at hobbies etc.)
Leisure

War

Environmental

We did not change the risk experience variables’ coding scheme, as it was already suitable for analysis. Risk experiences were coded either as 0 (not selected, i.e., “no”) or 1 (selected, i.e., “yes”).
Risk experiences were originally piped in the survey in the following way:

The question was a multiple-choice question, with no restrictions on how many choices the respondent made (except for the ones below).



If a respondent chose any of the twelve first experiences (question_25_row_1 to question_25_row_12), the final two choices were greyed out and unavailable.
If a respondent chose “I have not been engaged with emergency services personnel”, all other choices became unavailable.
If a respondent chose “I cannot say”, all other choices became unavailable.
Thus, the maximum choices were twelve unique emergency services personnel contact experiences.
Choosing “No” or “Cannot say” was exclusive to all other responses.

title: Networks of Risk Perception - Supplementary Website
text:
This website is a supplement to the chapter”Networks of Risk Perception” by Jan-Erik Anderson, Alisa Puustinen & Oliver Saal, to be published in the anthology Information Resilience in a Complex System of National Security.
The website contains the necessary R code to reproduce all analyses published in the original article. It also contains robustness checks and other model analyses deemed important for the reproduction and confirmation of the results, but not published in the main manuscript.
For questions regarding the article itself, please contact the corresponding author according to the anthology instructions.
For questions regarding this supplementary website, please contact O. Saal. Contact information is published in the anthology chapter.
This website was written using the Quarto publishing system and hosted with GitHub Pages.
